Key Arguments: The bill violates freedom of speech rights for Australian citizens.
It places excessive power in the hands of a government agency, the ACMA, which is not equipped to determine misinformation.
The government itself has been a source of misinformation, particularly regarding COVID-19 measures.
Fact checkers, proposed to be used by ACMA, have been unreliable in the past.
The bill contradicts Australia's commitment to the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.
Notable Quotes: Not only would this Bill violate my rights, and the rights of every other Australian citizen, to have freedom of speech...
Sadly, over the past few years, it has been the experience of Australian citizens that our government has been the greatest disseminator of 'misinformation and disinformation'.
Why would our government sign something like this and then introduce a bill which goes totally against it?
